title: Lenovo: Current Moto Mods Will be Compatible for Next 3 Years of Phones, 12 New Ones Coming
text:
Next Story Huawei Announces Honor VR Camera, Another 360-Degree Video Product Kanoosh 
hey at least they are sticking to their guns unlilke LG… wish the design was a little better but whatever. Raven 
I am not really interested in any of the mods other than battery packs. They just need to release some decent battery mods at a decent price. Let’s have a 3000mah pack for $20 and a 5000mah pack for $30 and I will be sold. The $80 regular price (got half off for buying with phone) of the 3000mah pack that my wife bought to go with her Moto Z Play was ridiculous. But, she does love being able to hot swap that battery pack. Matt Lang 
Lenovo was also not going to kill off the Moto X line, but I think we all see how that played out Adrian Fishler 
Wooot. Much excite. I love my Z, and I’ve already backed a couple of the upcoming mods on Indiegogo. Interested to see what else they can come up with. Good_Ole_Pinocchio 
3 years of the same very wide design? That’s definitely commitment Tony Gultice 
The only thing that needs to stay the same is the back of the phone. the front can go bezel-less, or the chin can be shrunk, hell even the fingerprint sensor could be integrated into the display. The actual width of the phone feels good. Good_Ole_Pinocchio 
My only issue with the Z Play was that it was too wide The Doctor 
The phone has been out for seven months already and there has yet to be a new Moto Mod on the market.
